summary: The document is a letter from Richard Helms, Director of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization, to Sir Charles C. F. Spry, Director General, regarding the declassification status of Warren Commission documents Cu-371 and Cu-372. It references an August 1968 inquiry that anticipated but did not encounter pressure for the release of Warren Commission papers. The letter concludes with the decision not to release Cu-372 at present and cites Sir Charles's arguments as justification for maintaining the document's classified status if questioned in the future.
key_findings: The letter addresses the non-declassification of Warren Commission document Cu-371.
An August 1968 inquiry expected but did not face pressure for the release of Warren Commission papers.
There are no plans to release Cu-372 currently.
Sir Charles C. F. Spry's arguments are considered adequate to justify the document's continued classification.
